title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 May 2014 - XWiki

08:43 <mosulica> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <mosulica> Thanks alot mflorea , after I've merged branch feature-alfresco-link from stable-6.0.x and recompiled wysiwyg, It now works to upload documents from alfresco on xwiki, with both of them having the latest versions. Thanks again!  
08:46 <mflorea> mosulica: great! you're welcome ;)  
08:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki

09:32 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:40 <vmassol> fixing syntax page  
09:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: the removal of the 5.2 branch broke the syntax page fyi, fixing it...  
09:42 <vmassol> :)  
09:43 <evalica> has quit  
09:43 <lucaa> has quit  
09:45 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <mflorea> vmassol: it was me who deleted the branch, and it doesn't sound right to me that the syntax page depends on a branch  
09:57 <tmortagne> msmeria: Hi  
09:57 <tmortagne> would be great if would could take care of http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki601#HTestedBrowsers26Databases  
09:57 <tmortagne> I'm about to start the maven/git release  
09:58 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok I will  
09:58 <tmortagne> thanks :)  
09:58 <tmortagne> [WARN] starting 6.0.1 release in 5 minutes  
10:08 <gdelhumeau> Guys, I have seen a lot of commits on the stable-5.4.x branch since the release of 5.4.4  
10:09 <gdelhumeau> Do you think we need to release a 5.4.5 soon?  
10:14 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: yes, we need one indeed, 33 issues: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10351?filter=12993  
10:14 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?filter=12993  
10:14 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yes a 5.4.5 sounds required  
10:14 <vmassol> creating dashboard for it  
10:15 <vmassol> here: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=12293  
10:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: want to take care of it? :)  
10:23 <vmassol> oh…..  
10:23 <vmassol> today is Thursday....  
10:23 <vmassol> and Thursdays are… XWiki Days....  
10:23 <cjd> EVERYDAY IS XWIKI DAY :D  
10:23 <vmassol> we're not that bad on the 1600 time frame re bugs  
10:24 <vmassol> 3619 vs 3616  
10:24 <vmassol> seems we're holding up :)  
10:25 <tmortagne> yep  
10:25 <tmortagne> deprecation day ? we have time to fix the result of the day before M2 :)  
10:26 <vmassol> various types of days are listed here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiDays  
10:26 <vmassol> so wdyt? should we do one today or skip it and decide for next week and this time do it next week? :)  
10:26 <vmassol> IMO best is to do it next week since it's already late  
10:28 <vmassol> PR Day might be a good one, to review all PRs and ensure we've replied to all  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I can handle the 5.4.5 release, as I was responsible for the 5.4.x branch  
10:28 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: cool :)  
10:28 <vmassol> you've just been elected for the 5.4.5 release! :)  
10:28 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> Can I release it today?  
10:29 <vmassol> if CI is ok sure  
10:30 <vmassol> do we have it in CI?  
10:30 <vmassol> if not it should be added first and ensure a full build works  
10:31 <gdelhumeau> and I should let tmortagne finishes his own release too ;)  
10:31 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yep  
10:31 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau: not sure if you know but we have a jeknins script to create a branch, ping me if you need help)  
10:31 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes we did not removed it from CI  
10:31 <vmassol> (can't access ci atm)  
10:31 <vmassol> ok cool  
10:31 <gdelhumeau> AFAIR, we have it on CI  
10:32 <gdelhumeau> but it is so slow that I can't verify right now ;)  
10:32 <tmortagne> there is even ui test failing since a long time now  
10:32 <tmortagne> does not looks like a flickring  
10:32 <tmortagne> (age 35)  
10:32 <gdelhumeau> yep: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-5.4.x/  
10:36 <mflorea> has quit  
10:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> ok, it is not a flicker, but there is no bug neither  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> We should fix the test  
10:56 <polx> has quit  
10:58 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <polx> has quit  
11:11 <spawn57\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <spawn57\_> hi, is there any documentation on managing users across subwikis?  
11:15 <vmassol> spawn57\_: what do you wish to know? The doc we have covers it AFAIK  
11:15 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WebHome  
11:15 <spawn57\_> I'm added a user in my global xwiki, and I wnat to give that user access to subwikis.  
11:15 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/User+Management and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights  
11:16 <vmassol> there's also http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement  
11:16 <vmassol> (spawn57\_)  
11:17 <vmassol> but indeed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement we could have another screenshot showing groups from the main wiki  
11:17 <spawn57\_> I see  
11:17 <vmassol> would be nice if someone could imrpove that ;)  
11:17 <spawn57\_> I've seen these docs  
11:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: the release agent is all yours  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> thx tmortagne  
11:32 <tmortagne> looks like our script to create ow2 pages is definitely dead...  
11:33 <tmortagne> what I don't understand is that the requests don't fail  
11:49 <tmortagne> ha I think I found why it's not working anymore  
11:49 <tmortagne> seems to be caused by a curl upgrade  
11:49 <tmortagne> looks like some parameters changed  
11:50 <tmortagne> hmm maybe not actually  
11:55 <junix659> has quit  
12:05 <junix659> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <junix659> has quit  
12:30 <lucaa> has quit  
12:34 <tmortagne> I don't understand I send the exact same thing that the browser with curl and I end up in the page  
12:34 <tmortagne> it's like ow2 was checking the user agent  
12:35 <tmortagne> lets try with FF user agent...  
12:45 <tmortagne> hmm website produces tons on error in my browser console  
12:59 <spawn57\_> has quit  
13:10 <kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <tillo> has quit  
13:59 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <msmeria> tmortagne: hi  
14:17 <tmortagne> msmeria: hi again :)  
14:17 <msmeria> I have a mini-issue related to XWIKI-10327  
14:17 <msmeria> http://s2.postimg.org/s6cfns6jd/image.png  
14:18 <msmeria> the percentage is always displayed as "X0%" except for 30  
14:19 <msmeria> it's very trivial, but I thought I should mention it :)  
14:19 <tmortagne> msmeria: yea I saw it it's because the progress is stored as a float between 0 and 1 and the percent version is calculated in velocity  
14:19 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:19 <tmortagne> I need to find a way to convert the float in int in velocity  
14:20 <msmeria> tmortagne: so it's worth reporting then ?  
14:20 <tmortagne> sure, report it under 6.1M1 since mflorea is finishing the release  
14:20 <tmortagne> it should be fixed for sure  
14:20 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok, I will. thanks!  
14:21 <tmortagne> I was too lazy to look at it that's all  
14:21 <cjd> #set ($lol = [ $myFloat ])   $lol.get(0).intValue()  
14:21 <cjd> idk  
14:23 <tmortagne> cjd: actually $myfloat.intValue() should be enough, Velocity has to work with Object for the variable already  
14:23 <tmortagne> just forgot about Number#intValue() thanks  
14:23 <cjd> ahh cool  
14:24 <tmortagne> :)
